Comments_List: The course provides a detailed overview to lithic analysis which is essential to understanding and interpreting the archaeological record.
I learned a lot of things about lithic technologies - theory and actual technology.
I learned a great deal about lithic tools, their production, and how to recognize them in archaeological contexts. This was crucial knowledge that I am happy Professor Chinchilla taught.
The seminar format facilitates excellent class discussion.

The workshops and lab sessions, especially in the production of lithics, are the best part of the course. They bring home the lessons of the many readings and make it real, and experimental.

I would like to see more discussion of the artistic side of lithic production, perhaps two sessions rather than one. However, this is a minor concern - the class already covers a wealth of topics.
Yes this course is a must for students in archaeological studies and anthropology.
I would definitely recommend this course to other students who are interested in prehistoric technology.
For students already interested in lithic technology and archaeology, I would consider recommending. It's quite a dense course however and not for non-majors.
